steps.p: We are speeding on a highway to <span class="carbonDi"> CO₂
The more CO2 the more heat gets trapped, the hotter our planet gets - and this isn't good.
Human activity has been increasing the amount of CO<sub>2 in the atmosphere since 1850 but...
… since 1960, more of it is getting out there and faster than ever before.
By current estimates, we have emitted about 2,200 gigatonnes of CO<sub>2 in the atmosphere.
That means, we are already at 1ºC of global warming which is already super bad for our planet.
Where has all that CO<sub>2 come from? Most of it has been from direct emissions from fossil fuel combustion, all types or energy production, and industrial processes.
Those were just the direct emissions. There is also CO<sub>2 accumulating resulting from deliberate human activities on land, including those leading to land-use change.
At the current speed of increase, global warming will reach 1.5 ºC by 2040
We need to slow this down. There is something we can do, now it's your turn to take action.

article.kicker: We are speeding on a highway to hell...
article.head: ...and we need to slow down .
